item.title: Migrating to Hugo
item.description: 1 Installing ‘tuftesque’ theme 2 Setting up a navigation bar 2.1 nav element 2.1.1 .navbar-brand class 2.2 button element 2.3 .collapse.navbar-collapse class 2.4 Adding padding to the body 3 Adding syntax highlighting I moved this blog from Jekyll to Hugo because I felt like I was missing out on blogdown. I spent days browsing for that right theme all over https://themes.gohugo.io/, but I finally made up my mind to use Nick Strayer’s tuftesque, which was one of Yihui Xie’s honorable mentions for impressive blogdown implementation.
